overview: In the spring of 2009 Erik founded BlueSwarm, the precursor to Fundly, based on technology originally developed by eNlisson International. Erik founded eNilsson in 1998 and to serve the corporate web technologies market and expanded into politics. eNilsson quickly scaled the political ranks to include senatorial, gubernatorial, and presidential clients. For his work during the 2008 election cycle, Erik received 2 Polly Awards and 2 Reed Awards. Erik’s first venture backed company, CareScout, was profitably acquired by Genworth North America in 2008. Prior to taking the entrepreneurial plunge, Erik was a marketing and executive at Bowne & Co. and Hoffmann-La Roche. Erik is a graduate of Middlebury College.
